Logical Reasoning.ques: Look at this series: 7, 10, 8, 11, 9, 12, ... What number should come next?
Look at this series: 8, 6, 9, 23, 87 , ... What number should come next?
An Informal Gathering occurs when a group of people get together in a casual, relaxed manner. Which situation below is the best example of an Informal Gathering?
Logical Reasoning.op1: The book club meets on the first Thursday evening of every month.
Logical Reasoning.op2: After finding out about his promotion, Jeremy and a few coworkers decide to go out for a quick drink after work.
Logical Reasoning.op3: Mary sends out 25 invitations for the bridal shower she is giving for her sister.
Logical Reasoning.op4: Whenever she eats at the Mexican restaurant, Clara seems to run into Peter.
Logical Reasoning.ans: After finding out about his promotion, Jeremy and a few coworkers decide to go out for a quick drink after work.

Logical Reasoning.ques: If every cat has a tail, and Fluffy is a cat, what can we conclude?
If every car has wheels, and this vehicle is a car, what can we conclude?
Logical Reasoning.op2: This vehicle does not have wheels

Logical Reasoning.ques: Identify the pattern in the series: 4, 7, 11, 16, ...
What is the next number in the series: 18, 16, 14, 12, ...?
Identify the pattern in the series: B, C, E, H, ...
What is the next letter in the series: P, R, T, V, ...?

Verbal Reasoning.ques: Arrange the words given below in a meaningful sequence.  Key, Door, Loc, Room, Switch on

If A + B means A is the mother of B; A - B means A is the brother of B; A % B means A is the father of B and A x B means A is the sister of B, which of the following shows that P is the maternal uncle of Q?
Introducing a boy, a girl said, 'He is the son of the daughter of the father of my uncle.' How is the boy related to the girl?
If X + Y means X is the daughter of Y; X - Y means X is the brother of Y; X % Y means X is the father of Y and X x Y means X is the sister of Y. Which of the following means I is the niece of J?
Which one of the following is always found in 'Bravery'?
What is found necessarily in newspaper?
Choose the word which is different from the rest.
Choose the word which is different from the rest.

Arithmetic Aptitude.ques: An aeroplane covers a certain distance at a speed of 240 kmph in 5 hours. To cover the same distance in 1 hour, it must travel at a speed of:
What will be the day of the week 15th August, 2010?

A man standing at a point P is watching the top of a tower, which makes an angle of elevation of 30° with the man's eye. The man walks some distance towards the tower to watch its top, and the angle of the elevation becomes 60°. What is the distance between the base of the tower and the point P?
A man purchased a cow for Rs. 3000 and sold it the same day for Rs. 3600, allowing the buyer a credit of 2 years. If the rate of interest be 10% per annum, then the man has a gain of:
Find the greatest number that will divide 43, 91, and 183 so as to leave the same remainder in each case.

A bank offers 5% compound interest calculated on a half-yearly basis. A customer deposits Rs. 1600 each on 1st January and 1st July of a year. At the end of the year, the amount he would have gained by way of interest is:
A boat can travel with a speed of 13 km/hr in still water. If the speed of the stream is 4 km/hr, find the time taken by the boat to go 68 km downstream.
Two numbers are respectively 20% and 50% more than a third number. The ratio of the two numbers is:
In a 100 m race, A can give B 10 m and C 28 m. In the same race B can give C:
An accurate clock shows 8 o'clock in the morning. Through how many degrees will the hour hand rotate when the clock shows 2 o'clock in the afternoon?

C.ques: What are the types of linkages?
Which of the following cannot be checked in a switch-case statement?
In which header file is the NULL macro defined?
If a variable is a pointer to a structure, then which of the following operator is used to access data members of the structure through the pointer variable?
What will happen if in a C program you assign a value to an array element whose subscript exceeds the size of the array?
C.op1: The element will be set to 0.
C.op2: The compiler would report an error.
C.op3: The program may crash if some important data gets overwritten.
C.op4: The array size would appropriately grow.
C.ans: The program may crash if some important data gets overwritten.

C.ques:
What does the following declaration mean?
int (*ptr)[10];
C.op1: ptr is array of pointers to 10 integers
C.op2: ptr is a pointer to an array of 10 integers
C.op3: ptr is an array of 10 integers
C.op4: ptr is a pointer to array
C.ans: ptr is a pointer to an array of 10 integers

C.ques: In C, if you pass an array as an argument to a function, what actually gets passed?
C.op4: Address of the last element of array

C.ques: What will the function rewind() do?
C.op1: Reposition the file pointer to a character reverse.
C.op2: Reposition the file pointer stream to end of file.
C.op3: Reposition the file pointer to the beginning of that line.
C.op4: Reposition the file pointer to the beginning of the file.
C.ans: Reposition the file pointer to the beginning of the file.

C++.ques: Which of the following type of class allows only one object of it to be created?
Which of the following statement is correct?
C++.op1: Class is an instance of an object.
C++.op2: Object is an instance of a class.
C++.op3: Class is an instance of a data type.
C++.op4: Object is an instance of a data type.
C++.ans: Object is an instance of a class.

C++.ques: Which of the following provides a reuse mechanism?
Which of the following statements is correct in C++?
C++.op1: Classes cannot have data as protected members.
C++.op2: Structures can have functions as members.
C++.op3: Class members are public by default.
C++.op4: Structure members are private by default.
C++.ans: Structure members are private by default.

C++.op1: It will not compile because the class body of Birds is not defined.
C++.op2: It will not compile because the class body of Peacock is not defined.
C++.op3: It will not compile because a class cannot be protectedly inherited from another class.

C++.ques: How can we make a class abstract?
C++.op1: By making all member functions constant.
C++.op2: By making at least one member function as a pure virtual function.
C++.op3: By declaring it abstract using the static keyword.
C++.op4: By declaring it abstract using the virtual keyword.
C++.ans: By making at least one member function as a pure virtual function.

C++.ques: Which of the following statements is correct regarding the destructor of the base class?
C++.op1: Destructor of the base class should always be static.
C++.op2: Destructor of the base class should always be virtual.
C++.op3: Destructor of the base class should not be virtual.
C++.op4: Destructor of the base class should always be private.
C++.ans: Destructor of the base class should always be virtual.

C++.ques: Which of the following function prototypes is perfectly acceptable?
Which of the following function / types of function cannot have default parameters?
Which one of the following options is correct?
C++.op1: Friend function can access public data members of the class.
C++.op2: Friend function can access protected data members of the class.
C++.op3: Friend function can access private data members of the class.

Java.ques: Which will legally declare, construct, and initialize an array?
Which is a reserved word in the Java programming language?
Which is a valid keyword in Java?
Which is a valid declaration of a String?
What is the name of the method used to start a thread execution?
Which cannot directly cause a thread to stop executing?
Java.op1: Calling the SetPriority() method on a Thread object.
Java.op2: Calling the wait() method on an object.
Java.op3: Calling notify() method on an object.
Java.op4: Calling read() method on an InputStream object.
Java.ans: Calling read() method on an InputStream object.

Java.op1: After thread A is notified, or after two seconds.
Java.op2: After the lock on B is released, or after two seconds.
Java.op3: Two seconds after thread A is notified.
Java.op4: Two seconds after lock B is released.
Java.ans: Two seconds after lock B is released.

Java.ques: Which class or interface defines the wait(), notify(), and notifyAll() methods?
Which of the following would compile without error?
Which one of these lists contains only Java programming language keywords?
Java.op1: class, if, void, long, Int, continue
Java.op2: goto, instanceof, native, finally, default, throws
Java.op3: try, virtual, throw, final, volatile, transient
Java.ans: goto, instanceof, native, finally, default, throws

Java.ques: Which one of the following will declare an array and initialize it with five numbers?

Python.ques: What is the correct way to check if a key exists in a Python dictionary?
How do you open a file named 'data.txt' for writing in Python?
Which of the following is a valid way to define a function in Python?
What is the purpose of the 'pass' statement in Python?
Python.op1: It signifies the end of a code block.
Python.op2: It indicates a placeholder where code will go.
Python.op4: It skips the rest of the loop and continues with the next iteration.
Python.ans: It indicates a placeholder where code will go.

Python.ques: Which of the following is used to represent a multi-line string in Python?
What does the 'break' statement do in a loop?
Python.op1: It exits the loop and transfers control to the next iteration.
Python.op3: It skips the current iteration and continues with the next one.

Python.ques: What will be the output of the following code snippet?
Which of the following is not a valid data type in Python?
What is the purpose of the 'finally' block in a try-except statement?
Python.op2: To define the code that will always be executed, whether an exception occurs or not
Python.ans: To define the code that will always be executed, whether an exception occurs or not

Python.ques: In Python, what is the purpose of the 'pass' statement?
Python.op1: To break out of a loop
Python.op2: To continue to the next iteration of a loop
Python.op3: To do nothing and act as a placeholder
Python.ans: To do nothing and act as a placeholder

Python.ques: What does the 'with' statement do in Python?
Python.op2: It is used for exception handling
Python.op3: It is used for file handling
Python.op4: It is used for creating class instances
Python.ans: It is used for file handling

Database.ques: You can add a row using SQL in a database with which of the following?
The command to remove rows from a table 'CUSTOMER' is:
A subquery in an SQL SELECT statement:
Database.op1: can only be used with two tables.
Database.op2: can always be duplicated by a join.
Database.op3: has a distinct form that cannot be duplicated by a join.
Database.op4: cannot have its results sorted using ORDER BY.
Database.ans: can always be duplicated by a join.

Database.ques: To define what columns should be displayed in an SQL SELECT statement:
Database.op1: use FROM to name the source table(s) and list the columns to be shown after SELECT.
Database.op2: use USING to name the source table(s) and list the columns to be shown after SELECT.
Database.op3: use SELECT to name the source table(s) and list the columns to be shown after USING.
Database.op4: use USING to name the source table(s) and list the columns to be shown after WHERE.
Database.ans: use FROM to name the source table(s) and list the columns to be shown after SELECT.

Database.ques: The SQL statement that queries or reads data from a table is ________ .
Database.op4: None of the above is correct.

Database.ques: Where is metadata stored in MySQL?
Database.op4: None of the above is correct.

Database.ques: Which of the following indicates the maximum number of entities that can be involved in a relationship?
In a one-to-many relationship, the entity that is on the one side of the relationship is called a(n) ________ entity.
A recursive relationship is a relationship between an entity and ________ .

Networking.ques: What layer in the TCP/IP stack is equivalent to the Transport layer of the OSI model?
You want to implement a mechanism that automates the IP configuration, including IP address, subnet mask, default gateway, and DNS information. Which protocol will you use to accomplish this?
Which of the following is a private IP address?
What protocol is used to find the hardware address of a local device?
What is the maximum number of IP addresses that can be assigned to hosts on a local subnet that uses the 255.255.255.224 subnet mask?
You need to subnet a network that has 5 subnets, each with at least 16 hosts. Which classful subnet mask would you use?
Which configuration command must be in effect to allow the use of 8 subnets if the Class C subnet mask is 255.255.255.224?
Which command displays RIP routing updates?

Networking.op1: Information about a route should not be sent back in the direction from which the original update came.
Networking.op2: It splits the traffic when you have a large bus (horizon) physical network.
Networking.op3: It holds the regular updates from broadcasting to a downed link.
Networking.op4: It prevents regular update messages from reinstating a route that has gone down.
Networking.ans: Information about a route should not be sent back in the direction from which the original update came.
